connector.description: Interact with jBPM workflow engine over REST.

camel.sink.path.connectionURL.name: camel.sink.path.connectionURL
camel.sink.path.connectionURL.description: The URL to the jBPM server.

camel.sink.path.eventListenerType.name: camel.sink.path.eventListenerType
camel.sink.path.eventListenerType.description: Sets the event listener type to attach to

camel.sink.endpoint.attachmentId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.attachmentId
camel.sink.endpoint.attachmentId.description: attachId to use when retrieving attachments

camel.sink.endpoint.contentId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentId
camel.sink.endpoint.contentId.description: contentId to use when retrieving attachments

camel.sink.endpoint.emitterSendItems.name: camel.sink.endpoint.emitterSendItems
camel.sink.endpoint.emitterSendItems.description: Sets if event produced by emitter should be sent as single items or complete collection

camel.sink.endpoint.event.name: camel.sink.endpoint.event
camel.sink.endpoint.event.description: the data associated with this event when signalEvent operation is performed

camel.sink.endpoint.eventType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.eventType
camel.sink.endpoint.eventType.description: the type of event to use when signalEvent operation is performed

camel.sink.endpoint.maxNumber.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxNumber
camel.sink.endpoint.maxNumber.description: the maximum number of rules that should be fired

camel.sink.endpoint.page.name: camel.sink.endpoint.page
camel.sink.endpoint.page.description: The page to use when retrieving user tasks

camel.sink.endpoint.pageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.pageSize.description: The page size to use when retrieving user tasks

camel.sink.endpoint.processId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.processId
camel.sink.endpoint.processId.description: the id of the process that should be acted upon

camel.sink.endpoint.processInstanceId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.processInstanceId
camel.sink.endpoint.processInstanceId.description: the id of the process instance

camel.sink.endpoint.targetUserId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.targetUserId
camel.sink.endpoint.targetUserId.description: The targetUserId used when delegating a task

camel.sink.endpoint.task.name: camel.sink.endpoint.task
camel.sink.endpoint.task.description: The task instance to use with task operations

camel.sink.endpoint.userId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userId
camel.sink.endpoint.userId.description: userId to use with task operations

camel.sink.endpoint.value.name: camel.sink.endpoint.value
camel.sink.endpoint.value.description: the value to assign to the global identifier

camel.sink.endpoint.workItemId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.workItemId
camel.sink.endpoint.workItemId.description: the id of the work item

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.entities.name: camel.sink.endpoint.entities
camel.sink.endpoint.entities.description: The potentialOwners when nominateTask operation is performed

camel.sink.endpoint.extraJaxbClasses.name: camel.sink.endpoint.extraJaxbClasses
camel.sink.endpoint.extraJaxbClasses.description: To load additional classes when working with XML

camel.sink.endpoint.parameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.parameters
camel.sink.endpoint.parameters.description: the variables that should be set for various operations

camel.sink.endpoint.statuses.name: camel.sink.endpoint.statuses
camel.sink.endpoint.statuses.description: The list of status to use when filtering tasks

camel.component.jbpm.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.jbpm.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.jbpm.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.jbpm.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.jbpm.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.jbpm.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
